__TOC__



This week's Hug Day will focus on '''regression-potential''' bugs! 

After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your '''Launchpad Id''' in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after '''rowbgcolor='''.  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged. 

=== Tools ===

For doing your work easier during the hug days remember to use the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuBugDay/Tools|hugday-tools]]</nowiki>.

=== 5-a-day-ing ===

To sign up for 5-A-Day participation, please add your Launchpad ID to the Participants column. (This is not the email address you used for signing up for LP, but the last part of the URL that https://launchpad.net/people/+me redirects you to (everything behind the ~ sign)):

   1. Click on https://launchpad.net/people/+me
   2. Look at the URL bar, everything behind the ~ sign is your Launchpad ID. 

Also sign up here: https://launchpad.net/~5-a-day-participants/+join

=== Stock Responses ===

For problem specific Stock Responses see: <nowiki>[[Bugs-Responses]]</nowiki>

Read <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/QATeam/RegressionTracking|the regression bugs management procedure]]</nowiki>

=== 37 New Bugs ===
'''To mark it off the list you should:'''

* Confirm that it is a regression
* If it is a regression
** Add a tag regression-(release|update|proposed) '''and''' a tag with the release the regression was found in.
** Request any needed info, Subscribe, Status to incomplete '''or'''
** Nominate for the release affected by the bug and set status to Confirmed. (ask on IRC to confirm the nomination)
** In the description add the "Last known good version:"
** For extra hugs, verify the bug is still not fixed in the development release (Natty)
* If it is not a regression
** Remove any regression-* tag
** Reject any pending nomination

=== 14 Incomplete Bugs ===
'''To mark it off the list you should:'''

* Change the bug's status to "Confirmed" or "Triaged" if the reporter replied with enough information
* If it is a regression
** Add a tag regression-(release|update|proposed) '''and''' a tag with the release the regression was found in.
** Request any needed info, Subscribe, Status to incomplete '''or'''
** Nominate for the release affected by the bug and set status to Confirmed. (ask on IRC to confirm the nomination)
** In the description add the "Last known good version:"
** For extra hugs, verify the bug is still not fixed in the development release (Natty)
* If it is not a regression
** Remove any regression-* tag
'''or'''
* Ask a secondary follow up question and subscribe to the bug report
